intro: Payena obscura var. obscura, commonly known as the dark payena, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries such as Nigeria and Ghana. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
